text: hello this is chef John and we're making
tuna stuffed shells this is my entry in
the Tony no tuna chef challenge and the
style we're using is the tuna Ventresca
which is yellowfin tuna belly like the
ultimate tuna incredible so here we go
we're going to start with a simple
bechamel sauce we've made these before
butter flour cooked for three minutes
so over medium heat then we're going to
whisk in our cold milk once that's in
we're going to add some cayenne pepper
a little bit of fresh nutmeg and salt to
taste bring that to a simmer as soon as
it starts to bubble turn it off
whisk in a pinch of oregano and some
fontina cheese give it a stir and set it
aside we're also going to need to boil
20 jumbo shells of course according to
directions drain rinse and reserve and
then it's on to the filling starring the
tuna Ventresca
we're going to drain that but don't
throw away that olive oil it's too good
we're going to use that to saute our
onions
once those soften we're going to add
some garlic and some diced red pepper
saute that until soft we're going to add
that to our thawed frozen peas and by
the way we're going to have all the
exact ingredient amounts on the recipe
page so don't worry okay I'm going to
add one jar of the Tonino tuna Ventresca
some lemon zest and lemon juice some
fontina cheese one beaten egg and whole
milk ricotta a little dash of cayenne
and we're going to mix that up and our
filling is done okay taking nice big
rounded tablespoonfuls we are going to
fill our cooked jumbo shells you should
just have enough filling for 20 so
should look like that take 1/3 of the
reserved bechamel sauce coat the bottom
lay in your shells four by five this is
a standard 9 by 13 casserole dish top
with the rest of the sauce dust it with
Parmesan and we're going to bake that in
a 400 degree oven for about 20 minutes
or until golden brown so we're kind of
taking the classic tuna noodle casserole
and giving it a little gourmet twist
with the Tonino tuna Ventresca I really
hope you give this a try enjoy
you
